sentences.sContent: Luke came in with his hands in his pockets.
sentences.sCn: 卢克走了进来，双手插在口袋里。

sentences.sContent: The policeman told me to turn out my pockets (= take everything out of them ) .
sentences.sCn: 警察让我把口袋里的东西都掏出来。

sentences.sContent: Anthony snatched his letters and pocketed them.
sentences.sCn: 安东尼抓过他的信，放进了衣袋中。

synos.tran: 小型的，袖珍的；金钱上的

phrases.pCn: [美国俚语](吸毒时)处于心醉神迷的佳境中
气穴；（大气中使汽机突然下跌的）气陷
袖珍计算器；便携式计算器

remMethod.val: 口袋(pocket)里放着一个小小的火箭(rocket)模型

words.tran: 可放在口袋里的；可供私用的；可隐藏的

trans.tranOther: a type of small bag in or on a coat, trousers etc that you can put money, keys etc in
If someone pockets something, they put it in their pocket, for example, because they want to steal it or hide it

trans.tranCn: 小型的，袖珍的；金钱上的
trans.tranOther: You use pocket to describe something that is small enough to fit into a pocket, often something that is a smaller version of a larger item
